sentences.english: The 34 democratically elected leaders in the Western Hemisphere will attend the three-day summit.
sentences.chinese: 西半球34位民選領導人將出席這次爲期三天的會議。

sentences.english: And any other elected president will have even less sway over the military.
sentences.chinese: 而且任何其他民選總統對軍隊的影響力甚至更小。

sentences.english: I am the democratically elected leader of a freedom-loving democracy.
sentences.chinese: 我是熱愛自由的民主國家中的民選總統。

sentences.english: The president of R. O. C. are selected by all voters.
sentences.chinese: 中華民國總統是由民選產生。

sentences.english: Since the Islamic Revolution, Iran has played a role in acts of hostage-taking and violence against U.
sentences.chinese: 在冷戰期間，美國對伊朗的民選政府被推翻起了作用。

sentences.english: "You have to remember that most superdelegates are elected officials," he explaine.d
sentences.chinese: 你必須記得，大多數的超級代表是民選官員。

sentences.english: Because China's Government is not elected by the people its policies are run on behalf of the bureaucratic-capitalist class.
sentences.chinese: 因爲中國政府並非民選，其政策代表官僚資本家利益。

sentences.english: It works very similar, it works just like an elected government, in my opinion.
sentences.chinese: 在我看來，這就類似於民選政府。

sentences.english: An independent judiciary is one that is not subject to the whims of elected officials.
sentences.chinese: 一個獨立的司法系統不聽命於民選官員的意志。

sentences.english: Afghanistan has a democratically-elected President and National Assembly.
sentences.chinese: 阿富汗擁有民選總統和國民議會。

sentences.english: Although he thinks that he is the elected president, we do not think so.
sentences.chinese: 雖然他覺得自己是民選總統，但是我們不這麼覺得。
